meanings.definition: To make more liberal or free
meanings.sent1: The government decided to liberalize trade policies to allow more businesses to thrive.
meanings.sent2: Countries often liberalize their laws to promote equality and freedom for all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The idea to liberalize the school's dress code was met with mixed reactions from students.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to liberalize her strict diet by adding more variety to her meals.
meanings.sent5: The decision to liberalize access to healthcare was a significant step towards a healthier society.

meanings.definition: To become more liberal or free
meanings.sent1: Over time, societies tend to liberalize as people seek more personal freedoms.
meanings.sent2: Individuals may liberalize their beliefs as they are exposed to different perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The once conservative town began to liberalize its views on social issues.
meanings.sent4: Her mind started to liberalize after traveling to diverse countries and experiencing new cultures.
meanings.sent5: As technology advances, communication channels continue to liberalize, connecting people worldwide.
